message.content:
cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.NE 

This paper focuses on developing an unobtrusive and affordable system for monitoring perceived workload using consumer-grade smartwatches in real-life environments. The paper discusses the use of physiological data and accelerometer features to assess low and high workload and the application of deep learning techniques for workload detection. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also discusses the use of Long Short-Term Memory Networks for workload discrimination, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the challenges of in-the-wild applications, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.CY (Computers and Society) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the use of physiological data and deep learning techniques could also fall under the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
